page.title: 04Cappleside- a Rathmell farm
page.content: This large and beautiful{stone } {farmhouse}dates back to the early seventeenth century.A Georgian facade and several extensions were added after the Napoleonic Wars and a{school {room}(known as Aunt Laura's Folly) was built in 1900. Built on a sheltered site on the outskirts of Rathmell, it is commonly regarded as being the unofficial "manor house" of the village. There is no Lord of the Manor as such but the house has been in the{Geldard family } since the early nineteenth century and the head of that family has always been one of the important people in village life. The whole estate is over 1300 acres comprising several tenant farms as well as the main one.
